note.p: Clergyman and astronomer. BA, Trinity College, Dublin, 1819, DD 1835; admitted at Oxford ad eundem, 1835. Rector of Hayes, Kent, 1831–54. After the death of his wife in 1853 he resigned his living, 1854. Last heard of in Algiers, North Africa, in 1866; presumed dead in 1893.
Census returns of England and Wales 1851 (The National Archives: Public Record Office HO107/1606/189/15)
England & Wales, national probate calendar (index of wills and administrations), 1858–1995 (Ancestry.com, accessed 11 August 2022)
